website_summaries.verdict: A germ- and dirt-filtering GEOPRESS bottle is the ultimate portable water purifier for exploring nature, fishing, or for extreme emergencies.
pros: Filters out all bacteria, viruses, and protozoa
Filters particles, chemicals, and heavy metals
Improves odor and clarity of water
Makes it possible to drink water from sketchy sources
cons: It takes a lot of pressure to push unclean water through its filter

customer_reviews.title: I drank tainted bathroom water all over Southeast Asia for 2 months. IT WORKS!
customer_reviews.text: Amazing. Still got explosive 8 day diarrhea from Vietnam but I'm positive it was from contaminated fresh veggies cause they don't was their hands at all before they touch them. We both filled up in dirty bathroom sink water all over Southeast Asia for 2 months and were fine. But that last meal in Vietnam..... Don't eat fresh veggies!!! Cooked food only! Trust me. I'm in the hospital writing this review.
customer_reviews.author: Klassy

customer_reviews.title: Always safe now with my Grayl.
customer_reviews.text: This will be my new go to travel water bottle. I’ll be section hiking the AT this month and can’t wait to get some dirty water in this. I have a Berkey water filter system at home. After what the city of Flint did to its citizens, I take no chances with mine and my families water. Grayl now covers our travel water too. Update- used this all over the Smokey Mountains. Perfectly clean water in 8-10 seconds. Love this product and think I converted some hikers.
customer_reviews.author: Rita M.

customer_reviews.title: Very hard to separate the top from the bottom piece. Needs some sort of gripper or something
customer_reviews.text: Very expensive and not very user friendly. Concept is good but using it on regular basis gets very annoying. So difficult to fill because the two pieces are so hard to separate due to suction and no handhold. Maybe the size is too wide for women’s hands too and needs to be narrower and taller instead.
customer_reviews.author: reviewer

customer_reviews.title: THE BEST SINCE THE GRAYL LEGEND...
customer_reviews.text: this is the best since the grayl legend.. the ultralight was a bad design and prone to contamination. thats why the grayl legend was the best until now.. i cant press it in 9 seconds though, but still a lot faster than the legend.. easy cleanup no hidden crevices unlike the grayl legend. by far the best grayl has to offer.. grayl customer service is top notch.. the lids on my grayl legend failed, they were kind enough to send me replacement lids along with 3 backup plastic lids in case the stainless lids fail once more..
customer_reviews.author: FireStorm

customer_reviews.title: Do not use if you need reliable water
customer_reviews.text: Do not use this product if your going anywhere where you need a reliable water supply. The first issue is that it's poorly designed so the clean water storage unit wants to slip out of the casing. Secondly, in just the second use I dropped the bottle from about 2 feet onto dirt. The outer shell cracked, leaking water and rendering the unit unusable. This was a small fall onto dirt. Clearly very poor construction.
customer_reviews.author: JS

customer_reviews.title: Must have!!
customer_reviews.text: I highly recommend getting one of these, even if all you are doing is filtering tap water. Its to easy to use and the filters don’t cost that much for how long they last. The quality is excellent.
customer_reviews.author: Kfox

customer_reviews.title: Best Investment Ever
customer_reviews.text: I love it. It works perfectly. It’s very sturdy and well made with high-quality materials. 24oz is a perfect size, and it’s nice to have to refill it less often. I can finally trust my drinking water - thank you Grayl.
customer_reviews.author: Lucas

customer_reviews.title: So sad , can Grayl customer service help me
customer_reviews.text: Water came out from the sides i was not expecting this would happen, so sad
customer_reviews.author: starguillo

customer_reviews.title: This is a must have in camping and hiking
customer_reviews.text: I have heard good things about this product. And its so easy to use that a kid can do this . I had to get it . Can't wait to put it in to use. Im glade I got it.
customer_reviews.author: Martin Perez JR

customer_reviews.title: Best personal water filter available!
customer_reviews.text: I love the product itself, it is easy to use, works great, and well constructed. My only reservation is the slightly vague instructions about care and storage. I also couldn't get a straight answer from customer service. I assume it is the liability they are concerned with, but I would have just liked some parameters without having to figure it out on my own.
customer_reviews.author: SBurk

customer_reviews.title: Grayl does it right
customer_reviews.text: I am truly impressed by the design of this water purifier. I have bought more than an average number of water purifiers over the last 20 years. None of those was built with as much deep understanding and concern for what a hiker/ adventurer requires. Indeed, it is larger than some may prefer. But the fact that it removes viruses, dirt, and chemical impurities is stunning. It has becoming a highly discussed item on wilderness forums. Personally, I have bought not one, but two of them. One for myself, and one for a friend, just in case. The price and quality is excellent.
customer_reviews.author: Richard Dana

customer_reviews.title: Gives me headache
customer_reviews.text: Great concept. Bought two, one for me and one for my girl. Flushed the filters as recommended, and then some. After using it, the first one or two days we started getting headaches. We just tried it with the home and office tap water. We stop using it and we stopped getting headaches. Now we have a very expensive water bottle paperweight.
customer_reviews.author: Five O

customer_reviews.title: Great filter.
customer_reviews.text: Great filter. I used it for international travel. Plan on using it hiking. I also use it to make the water at work taste better. Some of the reviews have commented that the filter is hard to get into place and hard to filter. It just needs a hard twist, and it 'clicks' into place. Then, when filtering just place it on the ground and put your body weight on it, and it filters very easily.
customer_reviews.author: Just me

customer_reviews.title: Not useable for a small person.
customer_reviews.text: I simply could not use it if I did not sit on the floor with the bottle between my knees. This would have been impossible to do in many places. This bottle either needs to come with a warning or the design of the product needs a revision. It simply was not functional for a smaller person.
customer_reviews.author: Barbara Jackson

customer_reviews.title: OK for hiking but not international travel
customer_reviews.text: The "french press" design requires the container to be flat on the ground and all of your body weight to compress the water through the filter -- essentially useless as a portable, daily drinking bottle in countries where filtered drinking water is a necessity. I found it extremely difficult just to separate the outer container from the internal filter insert when the Grayl geopress first arrived. As I was about to travel to Bangladesh for ten days and needed a lightweight filtered bottle I could sip from throughout the day, the Grayl, unfortunately, was the wrong choice. I returned it and purchased the Water-to-Go bottle from a USA distributor; it worked perfectly.
customer_reviews.author: femwit

customer_reviews.title: Perfect product
customer_reviews.text: Love it! Easy to use, and saved us a ton on buying water. Used it for a long hiking trip in the mountains of Montana, and my daughter used it in Italy. Worked perfectly. Absolutely loved it. Highly recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: Neal Stein

customer_reviews.title: Great EDC
customer_reviews.text: Great purifier to EDC. Now I can drink tap water anywhere... even in mexico! That’s saves allot of money instead of buying bottled water. A purifier is better than a filter. Do some research and see for yourself. Everyone should have one! Edit* after some use I still feel the same way but I took one star away for not being a good option below freezing temperatures. There's different options I use for that small amount of time.
customer_reviews.author: Mata1911

customer_reviews.title: Used as my daily water bottle.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to replace all the plastic bottled water I would go through. I wanted something that easily filtered as well as the ability to easily be cleaned. The spout on this design is what sold me versus their ultralight version. I’ve been using it daily for three months now and still love it. It goes with me to work, travels, and even on errands. I air it out and let it dry nightly due to an odd taste from continued use and use a filtered pitcher while I’m home. All in all, I’m still completely satisfied with my purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Tommy

customer_reviews.title: Works as Advertised, Solid Product
customer_reviews.text: The product works pretty much as shown in the videos and described. The inner container is VERY snug inside the outer container, but I get that is necessary for the filter to work, it just doesn’t appear as snug in the videos as in Reality. A minor inconvenience. Otherwise, not complaints thus far. Does appear to be insulated for temperature of the water, so it will achieve the temperature of the surrounding environment.
customer_reviews.author: Supplanter

customer_reviews.title: Best water purification system ever!
customer_reviews.text: By far the easiest and most convenient water purification system I've ever used... Family and l just spent a month in Kenya, drank from all sorts of dubious and funky water sources with zero issues. Since it's so easy there was no inclination to procrastinate filtering water, so I was fully hydrated the entire time. Totally worth the price tag!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Worth the Price
customer_reviews.text: This bottle safely filtered tap water for me in airports, China, and South Korea. My parents used it in the Philippines and none of us got sick. You do have to push down slowly and make sure the cap is vented. Nothing like spaying water all over yourself and the airport floor! The design of the bottle is nice and sturdy and not too hard in the eyes. The rubber top did start to look a little worn but not bad. It's worth the price to not worry about buying bottled water while traveling.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Leaked within a few days of purchase--so disappointing
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this water filter based on thorough exploration of options. Went to SE Asia. Within first three uses vessels leaked despite all attempts to review recommended usage. My son had the same vessel and no leaking. Think I received a lemon and now, once home, find I am beyond the return date. YIKES
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Love this purifier.
customer_reviews.text: I travel for business extensively. About 40% is overseas where water is questionable. I no longer have to carry iodine tablets. The pressing action is not difficult if you follow the directions and lean into it with your upper body. The water tastes great! I'm happy to carry an extra filter cartridge as a backup but haven't needed it yet. 65 gallons will take me 3-4 months to reach.
customer_reviews.author: Idaforkian

customer_reviews.title: Grayl geopress
customer_reviews.text: I bought the geopress about 6 months ago and been using it daily and I haven't had any real problems. I haven't put anything to bad through it. The only thing that's a little weird is that sometimes you get alittle shot of water out the side but not much and I could be pushing it down unevenly, most the time I just push it down without paying attention. It is a little hard to push if you set it on the counter but if you set it on the ground and use your weight it's not bad.
customer_reviews.author: Shane Bright

customer_reviews.title: Better than life straw. Great for anglers/hunters.
customer_reviews.text: This product makes our lives so much easier while we are on a stream flyfishing with our toddlers. We have peace of mind that we can supply clean drinking water at a moment's notice. We did make of the mistake of trying to press down the water without having it vented, easily figured it out. The dry press is the best feature on this product, with life straw you would have to blow it out over and over, boil and let dry. With Grayl you simply dry press and it's ready for storage.
customer_reviews.author: Tyler G.

customer_reviews.title: Satisfied Customer
customer_reviews.text: Have tried many portable bottle water filter systems - the other one I like is the Oko. However, unlike many others, the Grayl Geopress has the advantage of not having you suck to get water through the filter and having filtered water held inside the bottle available for pouring or making food, such as Oatmeal or soup packets that you mix with water to cook or rehydrate. Does take effort to press down the filter to get the water clean and sometimes is does spray to the side. I weigh around 200 pounds and I put a boot on the top of the filter and force it down with my weight - result: clean filtered water asap. Recommended
customer_reviews.author: Travellr

customer_reviews.title: It is just a wasted  money!!!
customer_reviews.text: I am not able to get more than a glass of water from it.No matter what I am doing the water is running out and I am left with very little.No good,and expensive.Wasted money!!I carried it with me to Peru and I wasn't able to use it.BAD!!!
customer_reviews.author: VIORICA   ARACHELIAN

customer_reviews.title: Bought new. Received used
customer_reviews.text: When I separated the cylinders I was surprised because there was water inside a new product. I had to wash the bottle and replace to filter cartridge before having a chance to use it.
customer_reviews.author: Ron Brown

customer_reviews.title: Saves Money in the Long Run
customer_reviews.text: Awesome. I travel regularly and got tired of always buying bottled water or looking for a place to fill up. The 24 oz (this one) Grayl is cheaper in the long run than the smaller sized Grayl because each replacement filter lasts many more gallons than the smaller filter and is priced similarly.
customer_reviews.author: akidabi

customer_reviews.title: This is the best water filter on the market.
customer_reviews.text: After a doing lot of research I decide to buy the GRAYL. Not disappointed. Going to buy the smaller Backpacking model also. After several recent big Earthquakes to hit So. Cal in the last 2 weeks. The GRAYL is the perfect fit for your Earthquake kit. Many cities near the epicenter were without water for a week or more. Don't get caught without one.
customer_reviews.author: Larry Chronic Jr.

customer_reviews.title: Above average good peoudct
customer_reviews.text: Just too expensive - tough to use - Not everybday use kind - by luxury a luxury having not exceptional results. Good quality construction / material .
customer_reviews.author: Nadeem khawaja ( wermany )

customer_reviews.title: Works for me
customer_reviews.text: I got this while we do extended trips. I don’t like taking to buy & throw out water bottles for a 5 week long trip. This was a good solution. It isn’t super easy to use though. I manage. I’m a petite woman, but fortunately, I’m fairly strong as a weightlifter so I have the strength to use this. My husband things it’s too much of a hassle so he just buys bottled water.
customer_reviews.author: Star

customer_reviews.title: BUY IT!!!
customer_reviews.text: My husband and I got violently ill on a mission trip to Honduras. No seemingly-sketchy food or drink, but we ended up with Salmonella, Giardia, Shigella and 3 strains of E. Coli. 3 months later, a trip to the Dominican Republic had me concerned. I ordered the Grayl and it was amazing. Water tasted great and we had NO adverse events. Gamechanger! Biggest con is the pricetag. But being healthy and having peace of mind is definitely worth it
customer_reviews.author: Lisa

customer_reviews.title: Best Water Filter I own!
customer_reviews.text: As an avid outdoorsman, I have used many different types of water filters over the years. This water filter by far is the easiest to use, delivers exceptions performance and is very reasonably priced. The replacement cartridges are also reasonably priced. I would recommend this filter to anyone who travels or is in the great outdoors.
customer_reviews.author: John Taylor

customer_reviews.title: Tough to use but worth it.
customer_reviews.text: So this 24oz bottle is huge lol. However it’s great to have. Used it at the Sacramento River in Sacramento, California. Gave me clear clean, great tasting water. I will say it was a challenge taking it off and putting it back on but I figure it should be like that since it’s a cup since I could either clip it my backpack or put it in a pocket. I believe I’ll buy the small 16oz for local hiking and outings and I’ll use this 24oz for international travel, hiking, outings and etc.
customer_reviews.author: Tru

customer_reviews.title: Geet Yer H20 wid this awesome tool!
customer_reviews.text: This is a little piece of heaven, a well designed water bottle that I am taking to Sao Paulo to get rid of the tap water taste and make coffee without buying a lot of bottled water. It works better than I imagined and the taste is good. I'd buy another but they are a bit spendy, at $100 with tax still a great value. As an experienced road warrior I've come to realize value trumps price, and this an example of value for price, even at $100.
customer_reviews.author: james kinsey

customer_reviews.title: I didn’t get sick from the water!
customer_reviews.text: I took this on a backpacking trip this weekend. It filtered water very quickly and without much effort. My friend had a hand pump style one that fits on a Nalgene bottle and this was much faster and did not require me to carry any extra gear. I will probably bring a water bladder for next time, that way after I filter water I can dump it in the bladder and build up a bigger reservoir for camp cooking and those type of things.
customer_reviews.author: Kelsi Adams

customer_reviews.title: Best Bottle
customer_reviews.text: Excelente bottle. I have ben using it corn 3 months with same filter and have no problems. It’s durable and well maid. Filter at first wasn’t working as well I send them an email about it and they send me a new filter. Great company and product.
customer_reviews.author: Emory

customer_reviews.title: hold the press
customer_reviews.text: A great buy. I used it the very week I purchased it. I went camping where they have an old hand water pump. When I pumped out the water, I observed rust and some unknown algae like substance coming out. I lined up the dots and pressed. I took a drink of the cold water and it was great. I poured some water in a clear cup and did not see anything. A great buy
customer_reviews.author: Randy

customer_reviews.title: My New Favorite Travel Companion!
customer_reviews.text: I travel across US and around the world, living out of hotels 18 or more days a month. I used the Geopress my last two trips and love it. In the US, I use it to filter hotel chlorine water. Internationally and quite a bit otherwise, I use it to filter bottled water. Its nice to know, that if I do run out of bottled water internationally, I would feel safe drinking out of the tap. Its very durable and consequently a tad heavier than I would like, but well worth the weight. The Holy Grail of water purification!
customer_reviews.author: JMWarburton

customer_reviews.title: Must have for travel, trekking, and camping
customer_reviews.text: Love this! I used this on a 3 month trip through parts of Asia and the Middle East. It really came in handy trekking in Nepal and Bhutan for 6 weeks. So easy to use. My guide loved it
customer_reviews.author: DaRedBull

customer_reviews.title: Worth the money
customer_reviews.text: One of the best water filtration systems I have used so far however the price for the water filters are a little high in my opinion but you get what you pay for it. Word of advice for first-time buyers of this product run a fresh bottle of water through the filter just to get the new filter taste out before using.
customer_reviews.author: Jory

customer_reviews.title: Great for travel
customer_reviews.text: I loved having this water bottle on hand when traveling in Asia. Easy to use and carry. Creates fresh water on the go; I don’t have to worry about there being the things in it that I can’t see. I also brought a mini water bottle with me; I’d fill that up with water from this bottle, so I’d always have something to sip, even if I didn’t want to carry around this bottle (mostly when I was shopping or something).
customer_reviews.author: BC

customer_reviews.title: Worth its weight in Gold!
customer_reviews.text: This thing is amazing! I was hesitant to spend the money, but now I'm gonna order a few more. Incredibly tough and well-built! Says it's good for 350 uses... Definitely a good buy.
customer_reviews.author: Hubbs

customer_reviews.title: Great tasting water, no bugs!
customer_reviews.text: Used it while in central America. My tummy is pretty sensitive to any bugs (a magnet really). I had 0 issues! So complete success. Bonus is the water tastes great. It does take a bit to get use to how it works. Easy if you have help pulling it apart. Eventually I could do it on my own.
customer_reviews.author: Tracy J

customer_reviews.title: It works!
customer_reviews.text: Brought this bottle on a trip to South East Asia to avoid using so much plastic. It was definitely a life saver! I filtered water from sinks in Thailand and Cambodia. I did not get sick what so ever so I'd say it works! It is worth the money if you're travelling somewhere with limited access to clean water.
customer_reviews.author: Cooper

customer_reviews.title: I don't need bottled water anymore
customer_reviews.text: I filter my water at home, and now when I'm away. No more having to lug several bottles of water (heavy) if I go out for the day. The design where you lean your body weight to push the cylinder down is genius. No more having to work out like a body builder in order to have a drink. I love it.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Not bad at all.
customer_reviews.text: I brought this for my trip to Thailand and let's say 2/3 of the time it worked perfectly and on a bigger note less plastic bottles to the world.
customer_reviews.author: Eyra

customer_reviews.title: Good but with some flaws
customer_reviews.text: Really nice for travel, and hiking, but with flaws. Occasionally when you are pressing down to filter the water the unfiltered water will squeeze through the seal causing a geyser if unfiltered water to spray. That can end up in your face or on the lid / sides of the water bottle risking cross contamination. Have used this for filtering nasty tasting hotel water as well as creek water while hiking.
customer_reviews.author: MXPUNK64

customer_reviews.title: Don't hesitate to get this
customer_reviews.text: Used this while travelling through Asia (India, Nepal). I filtered water with this, plus used water purifier tablet (Katadyn) and got myself clean reliable drinking water. I filtered 2 liters of water daily and it only took a few minutes (plus 4 hours for Katadyn to take effect). Filtering+water purifier tabs= 100% confidently clean drinking water. This bottle rocks.
customer_reviews.author: Vilma

customer_reviews.title: Really works!
customer_reviews.text: I used this in Cuba. Simply fill up the vessel with water and push the filter down into it. I am 105 lbs and it was a piece of cake. Just be sure to unscrew the cover of the drinking hole to allow air out. Otherwise you are trying to force the filter downward but the air compression will not allow it. My traveling companions used LifeStraws, which worked well for drinking. But that is all they are good for because the bottle filters the water as you suck it throught the straw. This one, however, can easily be used to pour purified water over toothbrushes or hands to clean them. Not possible with the LifeStraw brand.
customer_reviews.author: Annie B.

customer_reviews.title: Useful thing to have.
customer_reviews.text: I love this thing !! I have the Berkey at home but now I can have clean, filtered water with me at all times.
customer_reviews.author: Mr M R Cullen

customer_reviews.title: Works very well
customer_reviews.text: You have to twist it out and twist it in. People complain about water squirting out when pressing down. Spin it as you put in it and it won't do that. I had to learn that the hard way too!! Lol
customer_reviews.author: Sean P

customer_reviews.title: Functional, tasty, simple
customer_reviews.text: This is simple to use, no wait time or complicated pumps. Just press and go. I skim read the instructions. You do need to air this out in between trips, if you're not using it for a few days. Take it apart and air it out. Loved how functional, and no-nonsense it is. My first filter waterbottle. I looked at many reviews and videos, and chose this brand bc it seemed the least complicated for the most ounces.
customer_reviews.author: William Penn, he will be good, G-D knows when

customer_reviews.title: Stunningly good design
customer_reviews.text: The design of the product is inspired. If you really examine the product you'll find soft grippy panels in just the right spots, a neat recess for the cap and ergonomic pads for hands to push / operate the filter. Simply a great design. It is very convenient being able to safely drink local water versus having to haul water. I received the Grayl this week and used it to purify water from a mountain spring far from city water or paved road. Nice.
customer_reviews.author: George

customer_reviews.title: Grayl worked for me.
customer_reviews.text: I took this on a three-week trip to India and used it everywhere I had any doubt about the water quality. It is often said that you cannot prove a negative and, similarly, I cannot demonstrate that my Grayl stopped me getting sick. What I can say is that I used my Grayl and did not get sick. If and when I take a similar trip in future, I will take my Grayl. It is now being prepared for storage - in accordance with the instructions.
customer_reviews.author: Nick

customer_reviews.title: Made My Trip!
customer_reviews.text: Worked exactly as advertised. I used it for a one week trip to Peru. Backpacking on the Salkantay trail to Machu Picchu. Used it on the trail and at the motel,s train station, airport, etc. My daughter and I saved money on buying bottled water and didn't have to mess with purifying tablets. I would highly recommend this product!
customer_reviews.author: Minnesota Otter

customer_reviews.title: Great customer service for a great product
customer_reviews.text: When I got it, I tried it out and had a slight problem. A short email sent after 5 PM mountain standard time. They responded within twenty minutes and an easy fix. Now it works perfectly and is a prized piece of my field gear. I will be getting more for my scouts.
customer_reviews.author: MMK

customer_reviews.title: Works
customer_reviews.text: Have been using it daily for a month with no problems. I bought this one because it seems to be a better design than their little one. Read directions and apply a little muscle both opening it and when filtering.
customer_reviews.author: Lee in AZ

customer_reviews.title: Great product.
customer_reviews.text: We loved the bottle for our trip to Thailand. We made sure to not keep water in it during the flight, just in case the pressure change would cause any leaks. It is easy to fill and push down, even as a small women.
customer_reviews.author: nichole

customer_reviews.title: Love my Grayl
customer_reviews.text: I've only been using this for well water, and for that purpose it's been awesome! The water flavor is great! I love feeling like I'm protected from harmful viruses or bacteria. It's so easy to use and I've saved hundreds on bottled water so far.
customer_reviews.author: DAM

customer_reviews.title: Great for Travel...but not for everyone
customer_reviews.text: We used this for a trip to Egypt, Jordan and then Israel. We didn't filter any water from the rivers but rather the bottled water provided and tap water. This is a great product but it does require you to have the strength to pull the filter out and push down on the filter once the water bottled is filled. This is by design as it does ensure that all the water goes through the filter. I am in fairly good shape and struggled with this. Outside of that I would definitely recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: Kristi Feist

customer_reviews.title: Lifesaver for traveling in the Amazon
customer_reviews.text: We went on a recent trip to the Amazon and there were no “real” sources of clean water. Even the water that they supplied at the lodge was “iffy”. We were so happy we had brought these along to filter the water...Didn’t ever have to doubt or wonder if we would be sorry later for drinking the water.
customer_reviews.author: D. Lowery

customer_reviews.title: Love this!
customer_reviews.text: Travelled through rural Thailand and Laos with this. It must work, because I didn’t ever get sick. Haha. Loved having this with me. It is big for the amount of water it holds, so I had to refill frequently. Also didn’t like the rubber around the bottom as it made it difficult to put in my backpack side pocket. It took awhile to figure out how to easily pull out the inner bottle. Would highly recommend if you have access to clear water or a pre-filter.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: The last filter you will ever need
customer_reviews.text: A little heavier than other filters but it’s a water bottle and filter in one. Works super fast, built well and I can’t imagine a better design.
customer_reviews.author: Shaun

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for travel
customer_reviews.text: We will be using this on our trips and cruises. No need to worry about bottle water anymore, just add water to this Geopress and we're ready to go. Excellent quality and product. We'll be getting another one closer to our trip so we have one for each of us.
customer_reviews.author: J. F.

customer_reviews.title: 99/100. Would have been perfect if it didn't leak on the airplane bc of pressure change.
customer_reviews.text: I have only one complaint. When you take the water bottle on an airplane the pressure change makes it leak. Just make sure you empty it before getting on a plane. Otherwise, I love everything about this water bottle. I bring it to the beach all the time. It can't do salt water but it makes the fresh water shower water perfect on hot days.
customer_reviews.author: Anthony WPB

customer_reviews.title: Very easy to use.
customer_reviews.text: Great filter and super easy to use. I have not used this enough to judge the durability so I gave it 4 stars.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Water tastes weird
customer_reviews.text: This bottle is way too big. It's very durable, but I don't trust their claim that it filters any water. I've tried to filter some river water, but it tasted weird and the water wasn't perfectly clean.
customer_reviews.author: Julia

customer_reviews.title: Clean water in Thailand!
customer_reviews.text: Performed well, filtered water during our trip to Thailand. Takes a little elbow grease to separate the chambers, but the push needed to filter is not difficult. Used it to fill our canteens & hydration pack. Very pleased with this filtration system!
customer_reviews.author: KA Pavkov

customer_reviews.title: Quick and easy safe water when traveling
customer_reviews.text: I bought this product to use while traveling in Asia to be sure I had safe water. The product was easy to use and the water tasted good and I came back with no intestine issues during the entire trip. I would certainly recommend this product!
customer_reviews.author: asccarl

customer_reviews.title: Just a great purifier
customer_reviews.text: I have been using this purifier for almost a year. I have found it to be great and convenient for use in all aspects. I used it when I went to Thailand and I use it when I travel in the US. All around a great product. I like it so much that I even use it at home for the tap water. Recently I bought a second one just for traveling so that the first one can be used at home.
customer_reviews.author: Antonio Barron

customer_reviews.title: Love this water bottle
customer_reviews.text: I LOVE LOVE LOVE this water bottle!! It’s so easy to use and the water tastes great. If there was a bigger version I’d buy it too.
customer_reviews.author: Elizabeth

customer_reviews.title: Best water filter.
customer_reviews.text: Love the Grayl geopress. Much easier to use then the earlier version. The vent is clever and prevent contamination. The taste of the water is clear and clean. The non-slip easy grip and soft press makes it more comfortable to use. Will definitely buy again.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: howwell It works
customer_reviews.text: The best you can buy, and a very good company with very nice people and great service, a lot of great reviews also.Will tell others about this.Thank You GRAYL
customer_reviews.author: Robert Lo Bosco

customer_reviews.title: Excellent product / design.
customer_reviews.text: I don't often take time to write reviews, and I'm very critical of products and design. But this product is exceptional. I use the product daily and I continually sense the well-thought consideration that went into its design and materials. Buy with confidence. PS. I'm glad I choose the clear / opaque version.
customer_reviews.author: Ian M Cage

customer_reviews.title: Perfect
customer_reviews.text: I used this filter in 5 different countries in Africa with tap water, never got sick. Perfect!
customer_reviews.author: l corsa

customer_reviews.title: Convenient, tastes great, and good for Mother Earth!
customer_reviews.text: I love this water purifier!! I took it with me to Vietnam and drank tap water and stream water. I didn’t get sick at all. It takes a little muscle to push down the purification center but it’s completely worth not having to purchase water bottles. And it helps save the earth!! Love it!
customer_reviews.author: Stacey Wardlow

customer_reviews.title: Great purchase if you can afford it
customer_reviews.text: Tested this out with lake water as soon as I bought it and tasted great. I have used it while camping and drinking creek water as well. Very convenient and quick to drinking water
customer_reviews.author: KD

customer_reviews.title: Good item!
customer_reviews.text: Love the filter but be aware you need a bit of muscle to work it. Also the design is such that there is always some water at the bottom. That and the strength needed to get the filter part out to refill might create some water spilling!
customer_reviews.author: Norbert Ross

customer_reviews.title: Eliminated bottled water with this.
customer_reviews.text: The filter and bottle integration is seamless. I read the reviews about it being hard to press down, I have had zero issues with that. However, if you don't vent the screw top so the air can escape you won't be able to press down the top. It is well made, easy to wash and super easy to use.
customer_reviews.author: matthew Yee Sr

customer_reviews.title: Easy way to guarantee safe water during travel
customer_reviews.text: The Geopress is extremely simple and fast to use and provides great tasting, safe water from pretty much any source. We take this on all of our out of the country trips!
customer_reviews.author: BSW

customer_reviews.title: Feels solid and tried it
customer_reviews.text: Tried it at home. Hope it actually filters the germ. Feels cool to use it.
customer_reviews.author: H. Li

customer_reviews.title: Cleaning is not easy
customer_reviews.text: The problem is cleaning, you can’t clean the filer, so it’s maybe best to just use it as a pitcher and transfer the filtered water to a different water bottle, and drink out of it. Otherwise good product but just a bit expensive.
customer_reviews.author: Nicolas

customer_reviews.title: Great bottle for traveling
customer_reviews.text: I used this water Bottle every day while in India and was so impressed! I didn’t get sick, even drinking tap water with this bottle! The filter is truly revolutionary.
customer_reviews.author: koolkids

customer_reviews.title: Great, Easy To Use
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for a trip around Africa, it did great. Loved how simple it was to use.
customer_reviews.author: Travis

customer_reviews.title: awesome
customer_reviews.text: perfect for camping, go bag, emergency home use. grateful to get it. every house should have one.
customer_reviews.author: Jim

customer_reviews.title: Keep trying
customer_reviews.text: I need a practice. It’s kind of hard to push in. Also feel anxious about it. I will keep trying.
customer_reviews.author: Lulu Meow

customer_reviews.title: AWESOME FILTER CUP!
customer_reviews.text: This cup is great! We where in Peru for 10 days and used it to brush our teeth and drink from. We would also filter the water from the sink to put in our camel back. Saved us so much money in bottled water!
customer_reviews.author: Jennie gibbs

customer_reviews.title: Great bottle!
customer_reviews.text: I did not get sick from drinking water in Peru using my Geopress bottle and I have had people tell me the same who have used it on hikes drinking stream water as well. It is easy to use but does take a little muscle to push the filter through if you have the bottle on the counter. If it’s lower and you can use body weight it’s much easier!
customer_reviews.author: Amanda Roach

customer_reviews.title: Game changer.
customer_reviews.text: Game changer! Whether just using at ‘safe water’ hotels, cruise ships, etc to eliminate chlorine and other funky tastes OR while traveling to countries and areas with definitive questionable water supplies. Used all over and was proud to pull from a random source while others watched in horror as we drank our fresh, clean, and tasty Grayl water.
customer_reviews.author: Allen

customer_reviews.title: Add piece of mind to your adventure
customer_reviews.text: This filter is used by many people all over the world nothing packable is totally 100% but this is as close as you can get
customer_reviews.author: Richard

customer_reviews.title: Clean water
customer_reviews.text: Exactly what I was looking for. Clean purified water wherever I travel.
customer_reviews.author: Jason

customer_reviews.title: Great way to make drinkable water when traveling
customer_reviews.text: I didn’t think the filter would work as well as it does, but it is impressive! I can taste the difference between water that is filtered from water that is not. The filter does require steady force to filter but is easy enough. Now I would not travel without this water bottle and filter.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Someone’s mouths was on this before it got here
customer_reviews.text: I just opened the box and it’s been used. Scrape on top and moisture in the bottom
customer_reviews.author: Scott brander

customer_reviews.title: Makes drinking safe water an ease
customer_reviews.text: Outstanding product. Have been using overseas for three months now, seriously cuts down on my need to haul bottled water everywhere. Love it will always have one
customer_reviews.author: Rich

customer_reviews.title: Awesome
customer_reviews.text: My husband uses this often when on long hikes and is able to carry much less water and easily stay hydrated
customer_reviews.author: Jfwctt3

customer_reviews.title: Everyone should get this
customer_reviews.text: Works great. I can't imagine a simpler way to purify water.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin L Rose

customer_reviews.title: The best
customer_reviews.text: Have both sizes that Grayl offers! Best camping/hiking water purification system you can buy!!
customer_reviews.author: christian

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use
customer_reviews.text: Works great on hard tap water improves taste. I read some reviews that water would come out the sides but I think they did not loosen the top to let air escape
customer_reviews.author: Mary Duvall

product_meta.title: GRAYL Geopress 24 oz Water Purifier for Global Travel, Backpacking, Hiking, and Survival
feature_bullets: ONEPRESS GLOBAL PROTECTION: Empowers international travelers and outdoor adventurers to make the world’s sketchiest water sources safe and clean to drink. Ideal for global travel and outdoor adventures (hiking, camping, backpacking, fishing, hunting) and survival scenarios
REMOVES ALL PATHOGENS: Viruses, bacteria and protozoa - from any freshwater source on Earth. Filters pesticides, chemicals, heavy metals, and microplastics; improves taste

UNRIVALED EASE & SPEED: Effortlessly purifies 24 oz (710ml) of water in as quick as eight seconds. Requires no setup time, pumps, hoses, sucking, batteries, chemicals, or prolonged waiting. Simply – Fill. Press. Drink.
MAKES WATER TREATMENT EASY: Use your body weight on the SoftPress Comfort Pads to power purification. Drink and share safe, clean water through the SimpleVent Cap
AWARD WINNING ONEPRESS VERSATILITY: No straw, pump or gravity bag can match. Effortlessly fill from any spigot, hotel sink, murky river, taco stand, lake, or well.

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.8 out of 5 stars552 ratings4.8 out of 5 stars
